turn.0: ELI5: why can’t we domesticate all animals?
turn.1: See, you say that, but Australia is on the line and really disagrees
turn.3: Because Australia has massive placental mammal problem, cats being one of them. Feral cat hunting is a thing and apparently pretty fun. Cats have been responsible for a crapton of now-extinct species. If only they would just take out certain species like the possum (more of an NZ thing) but they do not discriminate that much.  I actually tracked down the Cat Man of Kangaroo Island to see about getting a catskin hat from him but I am glad I didn't because I found out later that owning cat fur anything (excepting a few circumstances) is a felony. Super lame, as I love the work he does.
turn.4: Ahh thank you for explaining! And Wow good thing you found that out and didn’t end up trying again later down the line!
turn.5: Yeah, I'm glad too. After I tracked him down I sort of wondered why I had never seen it elsewhere and whaddya know.
